title: The Pogostick Race and the Wobbly Bridge

args.text: You stand in a sun-dappled meadow, the air warm and alive with buzzing bees and daisies swaying in the breeze. Pogosticks are tucked in their hands — long, wobbly sticks with colorful caps. The race begins with a shared breath, the wind carrying the scent of clover.

args.description: Toad suddenly steps forward, his paws thumping on the ground, and knocks over a pile of wind chimes
A cascade of colorful bells erupts into the air, forming a shimmering rainbow arc above the meadow
Phi chirps excitedly and pounces toward the rainbow
Callie pauses, her eyes wide, and feels a gentle flutter of wonder at the colors
Toad shouts 'Poop-poop! The finest motor-car that ever was!' as he tries to straighten the chimes, but they wobble further
Phi bats playfully at a floating bell, then curls up and purrs softly
Callie begins to zigzag through a field of daisies, her movements precise and graceful
Toad, trying to keep up, stumbles and trips over a root, but then takes off in a sudden burst of speed
Phi leaps into the air, meowing softly, then lands on a daisy and begins to chew on it gently
The race reaches its end — all three stop at the edge of a quiet river, where the ground has shifted slightly under their feet
They all look down and realize they’ve built a giant, wobbly pogostick bridge across the river
The bridge creaks and then collapses into a puddle with a splash
Everyone laughs — Callie gasps with joy, Toad shouts 'Poop-poop! A bridge of pure chaos!', and Phi meows and pounces into the water
They all wade into the water, splashing and giggling, the rainbow bells now floating gently on the surface
They walk to the local ice cream stand, the sun dipping low in the sky, the air sweet with vanilla and rainbow swirls
Each takes one spoon of rainbow swirl ice cream — Callie sips slowly, Toad eats with gusto, and Phi curls up on the bench and purrs
They sit in silence, the world quiet now, the fun still humming in their bones
